results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Black People;Politics and Government;Elections, Senate;Race and Ethnicity;Walker, Herschel;Warnock, Raphael G;Republican Party;Senate;Democratic Party;Atlanta (Ga);Georgia
results.byline: By Maya King, Clyde McGrady and Jazmine Ulloa
results.title: In Georgia, a Heated Senate Race Stirs Mixed Emotions in Black Voters
results.abstract: The contest might have been a showcase of Black political power in the Deep South. But many Black voters say Herschel Walker’s turbulent campaign has marred the moment.

media.caption: Georgia has never had two Black major-party nominees compete for the Senate. The race has prompted interest and sensitive debates among Black voters.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.byline: By Jonah E. Bromwich and Lola Fadulu
results.title: Trump Approved Key Aspect of Company’s Scheme, Prosecutors Assert
results.abstract: Jurors at the Trump Organization trial will begin deliberating Monday after prosecutors presented a document they said showed that the former president had sanctioned tax fraud.

media.caption: Prosecutors said a paper signed by Donald J. Trump that reduced an executive’s salary showed how the scheme worked.
media.copyright: Hilary Swift for The New York Times

results.title: He Returned a Dazed Soldier to the Russians. Ukraine Calls It Treason.

results.title: For Centuries, Her Art Was Forgotten, or Credited to Men. No More.
results.abstract: The work of Michaelina Wautier, a 17th-century artist, was long overlooked. She is belatedly gaining recognition as an old master, as the first U.S. show of her work opens in Boston.

media.caption: A self portrait by Michaelina Wautier, created around 1645. Her paintings are drawing increasing attention from scholars.
